titleStmt.title: The translation of certaine latine verses written vppon her Maiesties death, called A comforting complaint This onely way I could declare my thankefull mind.
In mortem serenissimæ Reginæ Elizabethæ. English
titleStmt.author: Mulcaster, Richard, 1530?-1611.

publicationStmt.publisher: For Edward Aggas dwelling in long lane at the signe of the Oken tree,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: R.M., i.e. Richard Mulcaster.
A translation of "In mortem serenissimæ Reginæ Elizabethæ", with which it was probably issued.
Running title reads: A comforting complaint.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
